summary: Requires all stablecoin issuers and traders in UAE to obtain VARA licensing. Mandates AED-denominated reserve audits quarterly, bans privacy coins (Monero, ZCash), and introduces geo-fencing requirements for non-UAE IP addresses. Penalties up to AED 20 million.

DIFC-based framework requiring platforms to assess token suitability for retail investors, implement geo-fencing for restricted jurisdictions, and conduct real-time risk profiling. Introduces mandatory cooling-off periods for transactions above AED 100,000.

UAE adoption of the OECD Crypto-Asset Reporting Framework requiring automatic exchange of crypto transaction information with 50+ jurisdictions. Mandatory reporting for transactions exceeding AED 50,000 (~$13,600). Annual compliance certification required.
